55952.ControllerBinding_GyroNeutralAngle2DScro: This is the default position for a Centered joystick.  By changing this setting you can alter the neutral centered position to tilt forward or backward which is comfortable to your playing position.  Note that for uses like a steering wheel, it is recommended to disable the vertical portion entirely and just use the Horizontal Axis, where this angle will not come into play.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroAxis2DScroll_Descr: For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, you can use either the yaw or roll of the controller.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroAxis2DScroll_Yaw_D: For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, use the yaw of the controller.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroAxis2DScroll_Roll_: For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, use the roll of the controller.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseTriggerClamp_Trig: Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft Pull.  Squeezing either trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing either trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseTriggerClampAmoun: This sets how much the mouse movement should be dampened.  Slide to the right to further stop mouse movement.
55952.ControllerBinding_AbsMouseTouch_Descript: A command can be sent while touching the pad.  If momentum/trackball mode is active, this button will be released when it fully decays.  Otherwise, this button will be released the moment you stop touching the pad.
55952.ControllerBinding_LeanSensitivityAbsMous: This determines how far the controller must be turned to trigger lean commands.
55952.ControllerBinding_AbsMouseLeanRight_Desc: You can trigger this command when tilting the controller in the axis you aren't using for control.
55952.ControllerBinding_AbsMouseLeanLeft_Descr: You can trigger this command when tilting the controller in the axis you aren't using for control.
55952.ControllerBinding_TrackballMouseJoystick: Trackball mode makes the pad act like a trackball instead of a mouse.  It will have momentum and friction, allowing you to flick it like a trackball.
The mouse will move like a trackball.  It will have momentum and friction and can be flicked like a trackball.
The mouse will move like a normal mouse.  It will have not have momentum or friction.
55952.ControllerBinding_SensitivityMouseJoysti: Sets the sensitivity of this control.  NOTE: Since this mode is sending the game joystick output - the maximum sensitivity will be limited by the game's Gamepad Camera Sensitivity.  For best results, set the in-game Gamepad Camera Sensitivity option as high as possible.
55952.ControllerBinding_RotationMouseJoystick_: Rotation is the horizon line of mouse movement.  Swiping your thumb over the trackpad may result in a slighly canted movement.  You can align this rotation to match your natural movements, so that a quick swipe results in a perfectly horizontal mouse movement.
55952.ControllerBinding_HapticIntensityMouseJo: This sets the intensity of the haptics.
Do not use haptics for this mode.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseJoystickClick_Des: This command will be performed when you click the pad/stick.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseJoystickGyroLeft_: This command will be performed when you lean the controller to the left.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseJoystickGyroRight: This command will be performed when you lean the controller to the right.
55952.ControllerBinding_FrictionMouseJoystick_: Trackball friction determines how quickly the trackball slows to a stop when freely spinning.
If off the trackball will have no momentum.  It will act as if trackball mode is disabled.
With Low Friction, the trackball will continue to rotate for a long period after being flicked, slowly coming to a stop.
With Medium Friction, the trackball will rotate for a period after being flicked, gradually coming to a stop.
With High Friction, the trackball will spin for a short duration, quickly come to a stop after being flicked.
With No Friction, the trackball will spin forever after being flicked without outside intervention.
55952.ControllerBinding_VerticalFrictionMouseJ: Vertical Friction determines how fast the vertical movement comes to a stop relative to horizontal movement.  At 50% along the slider it is equal, if less than half it will slow less quickly, if more, more quickly.  For games were you control the camera, it is usually desirable to have high vertical friction so flicks are primarily used for spinning the camera along the horizontal axis.
55952.ControllerBinding_VerticalSensitivityMou: Vertical Sensitivity Scale determines how much vertical movement occurs relative to horizontal movement.  At 50% along the slider it is equal, if less than half it vertical movement will be lower than horizontal, while more will increase the ratio to more vertical movement.
55952.ControllerBinding_SmoothingMouseJoystick: Smoothing helps to remove noise and jitter from the mouse.  Smaller values will result in less filtering, while higher values will be more filtered and smoother.
55952.ControllerBinding_AccelerationMouseJoyst: Acceleration will cause faster movements to cause more mouse movement relative to slow movements for the same space covered on the pad.
With no acceleration movement will be 1:1, with the distance covered on the pad always resulting in the same in-game output regardless of the speed.
With low acceleration movement will be slightly accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output slightly greater at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
With medium acceleration movement will be fairly accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output quite a bit greater at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
With high acceleration movement will be very accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output extremely high at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
55952.ControllerBinding_AccelerationGyroMouseJ: Acceleration will cause faster movements to cause more mouse movement relative to slow movements for the same space covered on the pad.
With no acceleration movement will be 1:1, with the distance covered on the pad always resulting in the same in-game output regardless of the speed.
With low acceleration movement will be slightly accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output slightly greater at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
With medium acceleration movement will be fairly accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output quite a bit greater at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
With high acceleration movement will be very accelerated, with faster movements making in-game output extremely high at faster speeds for the same distance covered on the physical pad.
55952.ControllerBinding_DoubleTapMouseJoystick: A button can be sent when double tapping on the pad.  Tapping doesn't not require a full click, just a quick double-tap on the pad.
55952.ControllerBinding_DoubleTapDurationMouse: Double Tap Duration sets the time required between times to register as a double tap.  Lower values will require a very fast double tap while higher values will allow a long time between taps.
55952.ControllerBinding_DoubleTapBeepMouseJoys: Double Tap Beep will cause the controller to beep when a double tap is sent.
Double Tap Beep will cause the controller to beep when a double tap is sent.
Double Tap Beep will cause the controller to beep when a double tap is sent.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseTriggerClampMouse: The mouse movement can be dampened while the trigger is being pulled.  This can help to correct for accidental movement while pulling the trigger.
55952.ControllerBinding_EdgeSpinRadiusMouseJoy: The radius for the Edge Spin Speed zone.  The slider can be visualized as extending a radius from the center outward, with fully to the left as always edge spinning and fully right as only the very edge engaging edge spin.
55952.ControllerBinding_EdgeSpinScaleMouseJoys: If set, when outside the Edge Spin Radius on the pad, the mouse will continue to send input at a the specified rate in the specified direction.
55952.ControllerBinding_OutputJoystickMouseJoy: Signal will be sent out to the chosen joystick.
55952.ControllerBinding_InvertXMouseMouseJoyst: If set, moving left on the pad will move the mouse right, while moving right on the pad will move the mouse left.  Note that game settings often have this same setting, so you need to ensure they don't cancel each other out.

If set, moving left on the pad will move the mouse right, while moving right on the pad will move the mouse left.  Note that game settings often have this same setting, so you need to ensure they don't cancel each other out.
The mouse Horizontal axis will act normally, with left movement on the pad corresponding to left movement of the mouse.
55952.ControllerBinding_InvertMouseYMouseJoyst: If set, moving up on the pad will move the mouse down, while moving down on the pad will move the mouse up.  Note that game settings often have this same setting, so you need to ensure they don't cancel each other out.

If set, moving up on the pad will move the mouse down, while moving down on the pad will move the mouse up.  Note that game settings often have this same setting, so you need to ensure they don't cancel each other out.
The mouse vertical axis will act normally, with up movement on the pad corresponding to up movement of the mouse.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseMoveThresholdMous: The mouse will accumulate movement until this threshold has been passed and only send at that point.  Intended for applications that exhibit aggressive filtering/clamping of the mouse, which can cause small motions to be lost, but shouldn't generally be required.  Ideally this should be as small of a value while not losing input for small motions.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroButtonMouseJoystic: Gyro Enable Button
The gyro input can be turned on only when a button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Always On
The gyro input will always be active.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Pad Touch
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Trackpad is being touched.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Pad Touch
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Trackpad is being touched.
Gyro Enable Button - Unified Pad Touch
The gyro input will be on when any part of the Trackpad is being touched.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Pad Click
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Trackpad button is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Pad Click
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Trackpad button is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Bumper
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Bumper button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Bumper
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Bumper button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Grip
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Grip button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Grip
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Grip button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Trigger Full Pull
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Trigger button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Trigger Full Pull
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Trigger button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Trigger Soft Pull
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Trigger is barely pulled.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Trigger Soft Pull
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Trigger is barely pulled.
Gyro Enable Button - A
The gyro input will be on only when the A button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - B
The gyro input will be on only when the B button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - X
The gyro input will be on only when the X button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Y
The gyro input will be on only when the Y button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Cross
The gyro input will be on only when the Cross button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Circle
The gyro input will be on only when the Circle button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Square
The gyro input will be on only when the Square button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Triangle
The gyro input will be on only when the Triangle button is pressed.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Stick Click
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Stick is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Stick Click
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Stick is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Capture Button Click
The gyro input will be on only when the Capture button is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Trigger
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Trigger is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Trigger
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Trigger is clicked.
Gyro Enable Button - Left Stick Touch
The gyro input will be on only when the Left Stick is touched.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Stick Touch
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Stick is touched.
Gyro Enable Button - Right Stick or Right Pad Touch
The gyro input will be on only when the Right Stick or Right Trackpad is touched.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroAxisMouseJoystick_: For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, you can use either the yaw or roll of the controller.
For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, use the yaw of the controller.
For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, use the roll of the controller.
For controlling the horizontal movement of the mouse, use the yaw or roll of the controller.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroYawScaleMouseJoyst: When using both Yaw and Roll, the amount Yaw contributes from 0-100%.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroRollScaleMouseJoys: When using both Yaw and Roll, the amount Roll contributes from 0-100%.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseTriggerClampMouse: Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft Pull.  Squeezing either trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing either trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseTriggerClampAmoun: This sets how much the mouse movement should be dampened.  Slide to the right to further stop mouse movement.
55952.ControllerBinding_DeadzoneXJoystickMouse: This value determines the minimum amount the output joystick will send when swiping.  The ideal setting is adjusting it so the game's built in deadzone is exactly compensated for.  Adjust this value upwards until slow movements don't stop or stutter, but provide clean movement.  Move down if small movements are too big.  Also see the Enhance Small Movements setting.
55952.ControllerBinding_DeadzoneYJoystickMouse: This value determines the minimum amount the output joystick will send when swiping.  The ideal setting is adjusting it so the game's built in deadzone is exactly compensated for.  Adjust this value upwards until slow movements don't stop or stutter, but provide clean movement.  Move down if small movements are too big.  Also see the Enhance Small Movements setting.
55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_MouseJoys: This input feels like a mouse, but outputs a joystick.  This is intended for games which do not allow simultaneous mouse and gamepad inputs.  It's the next best option to the real thing for providing an emulated 1:1 response.  NOTE: Since this mode is seen by the game as a joystick, the sensitivity response is limited by the game's gamepad sensitivity settings.  For best results, set the in-game gamepad camera sensitivity to the highest value possible.
55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_Mouse_Des: This input translates a joystick into mouse or cursor output. NOTE: This input may be affected by both the layout's sensitivity and the in-game mouse sensitivity
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroSensitivityScaleMo: When using in combination with a pad also using Mouse Joystick mode, use this setting to scale the relative input of the gyro to be less or greater.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroPersonalizationOve: All gyro modes have common settings for sensitivity, smoothing, acceleration, and angle offset.  If this is set, the settings from the controller preferences will be used instead of the mode specific settings.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroNaturalSensitivity: When "Dots Per 360°" is correctly calibrated in game, this will multiply the output of the gyro to the mouse. 1x will give 1:1 real world gyro rotation to in world rotation. 2x will turn the in world camera twice as fast as the controller's rotation.

When "In-Game Max Turn Rate" is correctly calibrated in game, this will multiply the output of the gyro to the mouse. 1x will give 1:1 real world gyro rotation to in game rotation. 2x will turn the in world camera twice as fast as the controller's rotation.
55952.ControllerBinding_LeanSensitivityMouseJo: This determines how far the controller must be turned to trigger lean commands.
55952.ControllerBinding_GyroButtonInvertMouseJ: The gyro input button behavior can be flipped.  If set to off, gyro will turn off when the button is pressed.
If set, the device's gyro will turn on when the button is pressed.
If set, the device's gyro will turn off when the button is pressed.
If set, the device's gyro will toggle between being enabled or disabled when the button is pressed.
55952.ControllerBinding_HorizontalSensitivity_: Scale the horizontal sensitivity.  This will change the motion of the horizontal axis relative to the vertical.
55952.ControllerBinding_VerticalSensitivity_jo: Scale the vertical sensitivity. This will change the motion of the vertical axis relative to the horizontal.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseJoystickLeanRight: You can trigger this command when tilting the controller in the axis you aren't using for control.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseJoystickLeanLeft_: You can trigger this command when tilting the controller in the axis you aren't using for control.
55952.ControllerBinding_HapticIntensityMouseRe: This sets the intensity of the haptics.
Do not use haptics for this mode.
55952.ControllerBinding_EdgeBindingRadiusMouse: When outside this radius, the assigned button or key will be sent.  For example, the 'Run' or 'Sprint' button could be assigned when holding at the edge.  The slider can be visualized as extending a radius from the center outward, with the point being where the outer ring begins.
55952.ControllerBinding_EdgeBindingMouseRegion: When outside the specified radius, the assigned button or key will be sent.  For example, the 'Run' or 'Sprint' button could be assigned when holding at the edge.
55952.ControllerBinding_EdgeBindingInvertMouse: If set, the command will be sent when inside the radius instead of outside.  For example, 'Walk' or 'Sneak' could be sent when inside a certain zone.
The assigned button will be sent if inside the specified Outer Ring Command Radius. For example, 'Walk' or 'Sneak' could be sent when inside a certain zone.
The assigned button will be sent if outside the specified Outer Ring Command Radius. For example, 'Run' or 'Sprint' could be sent when outside a certain zone.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseRegionTriggerClam: Trigger Dampening will reduce the amount of movement output by this mode while the trigger is being pulled.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft Pull.  Squeezing the trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft Pull.  Squeezing either trigger will dampen any mouse movements until a full click is engaged.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Right Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Left Trigger Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing the trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
Trigger Dampening is enabled for the Both Triggers Soft/Full Pull.  Squeezing either trigger including clicking will dampen any mouse movements until fully released.
This sets how much the mouse movement should be dampened.  Slide to the right to further stop mouse movement.

55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerClick_Descripti: This command will be performed when you pull the trigger the entire way until it clicks (you'll hear a soft click).
55952.ControllerBinding_HoldRepeatsTrigger_On_: If turned on, holding any button will cause it to repeat.  This is often known as a 'Turbo Mode'.
55952.ControllerBinding_HoldRepeatsTrigger_Off: If turned on, holding any button will cause it to repeat.  This is often known as a 'Turbo Mode'.
55952.ControllerBinding_HoldRepeatIntervalTrig: When Turbo Mode is turned on, this determines the speed of the repeat.  Slide to the right for a faster repeat rate.
55952.ControllerBinding_OutputTrigger_Descript: When enabled, the analog value of the specified trigger will be sent to the game.  Only possible if the game recognizes XInput compatible gamepad values.
55952.ControllerBinding_OutputTrigger_TriggerO: No analog values will be sent.
55952.ControllerBinding_OutputTrigger_TriggerL: Analog values will be sent to the game as a Left Trigger.  Only possible if the game recognizes XInput compatible gamepad values.
55952.ControllerBinding_OutputTrigger_TriggerR: Analog values will be sent to the game as a Right Trigger.  Only possible if the game recognizes XInput compatible gamepad values.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerDeadZoneStart_D: This sets the deadzone for the analog trigger.  A greater value will create more of a 'deadzone' where no analog value will be sent when initially pressing the trigger down.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerDeadZoneEnd_Des: This sets the deadzone for the analog trigger.  A smaller value will create more of a 'deadzone' at the end of the range where the maximum analog value will be sent once past this point in the throw.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_D: This determines the mapping of analog input to output.  By default a linear 1:1 mapping is used.  This curve can altered so there is more or less room for fine controls.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_L: A Linear response curve maps the input directly to the output in a 1:1 fashion.  At 50% deflection, 50% output will be sent.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_1: An aggressive response curve gets to 100% output faster.  This gives less of a slow range and more quickly hits the upper range of output, with faster response.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_2: A relaxed response curve gets to 100% output slower.  There is slightly more slow range where fine control can be used and the upper range is pushed further towards the end.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_3: A wide response curve gets to 100% output much slower that default.  There is a wide range of low values which ramps up quickly at the end.  This allows for a wide amount of small values in the inner range while ramping to full at the outside.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_4: An extra wide response curve provides an large range of lower values over a wide band, only reaching 100% at the extremes.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCurveExponent_C: A Custom Curve can be defined using the response curve slider.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerCustomCurveExpo: Changing this slider adjusts the output response curve for the trigger.
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerAnalogThreshold: This command will be performed when you pull the trigger softly, but not the entire way (so you won't hear the full pull click).
55952.ControllerBinding_TriggerThreshold_Descr: The Soft Pull command will be sent when the trigger is pulled past this point.  For a light press, move the slider to the left, while one requiring a farther press of the trigger should be moved to the right.
55952.ControllerBinding_AdaptiveThreshold_Desc: In a game where dual stage triggers are enabled via the threshold as well as the click, hip fire allows a quick pull of the trigger to hit the physical button without engaging the threshold command, while a slower pull will engage the threshold first.  Aggressive Hip Fire will engage the threshold command much faster than Relaxed.
55952.ControllerBinding_AdaptiveThreshold_Trig: Good for mouse clicks and drags. As the trigger is pulled, the Soft Pull command is sent first, followed by the Full Pull.
Good for action games where you want to be able to rapidly send the Soft Pull command with quick pulls & releases.
Good for action games with both Full Pull and Soft Pull commands assigned. Quick pulls will only send the Full Pull, whereas slower pulls will send the Soft Pull first, followed by the Full Pull.
Same as the above, but with a larger time window in which the Soft Pull can be skipped.
An even larger time window in which the Soft Pull can be skipped.
Like the above options, except that once either of the Full Pull or Soft Pull commands have been sent, the other cannot be sent until the trigger has been fully released.
55952.ControllerBinding_AdaptiveThreshold_Hair: With the Hair Trigger setting, the threshold will adapt to the user.  Once the initial threshold has been passed, letting off the trigger by any degree will reset the trigger, allowing it to be pressed again, even if the trigger hasn't been released to the point of the initial threshold.  This is often desirable for situations like rapid firing a weapon where you want a small amount of throw to fire the first shot, but you don't want to have to let it return to full unpressed to fire again.  For commands that require holding the trigger continually, it may be less desirable, as any lessing of the trigger will cause the selected command to release.
55952.ControllerBinding_AdaptiveThreshold_Simp: Basic Threshold, the threshold is at a fixed throw specified by the selected value.  Once the specified threshold has been passed, letting off the trigger will not release the button until the trigger has been released to the point of the specified threshold.  For commands that require holding the trigger continually, where accidental button release is undesirable, this may be the preferred setting.
55952.ControllerBinding_AdaptiveThreshold_Long: Intended to be used with a dual-stage trigger setup, Hip Fire allows a quick pull of the trigger to engage the click without engaging the threshold.  A slower pull or hover will engage the threshold command.  This allows for commands such as iron-sights to be set on the threshold and fire on the click, while still allowing a quick pull to click to fire without entering iron-sights.  Additionally, once the click has been hit, the threshold won't be engaged until the trigger has been released outside of the threshold range, allowing it to be primed for additional clicks.  Aggressive Hip Fire mode is a very small window before engaging the threshold, requiring a very fast pull of the trigger to skip it.  The Threshold command will engage fastest here when intentionally enaging it.

Intended to be used with a dual-stage trigger setup, Hip Fire allows a quick pull of the trigger to engage the click without engaging the threshold.  A slower pull or hover will engage the threshold command.  This allows for commands such as iron-sights to be set on the threshold and fire on the click, while still allowing a quick pull to click to fire without entering iron-sights.  Additionally, once the click has been hit, the threshold won't be engaged until the trigger has been released outside of the threshold range, allowing it to be primed for additional clicks.  Normal Hip Fire mode has a window before engaging the threshold, requiring a quick pull of the trigger to avoid it.

Intended to be used with a dual-stage trigger setup, Hip Fire allows a quick pull of the trigger to engage the click without engaging the threshold.  A slower pull or hover will engage the threshold command.  This allows for commands such as iron-sights to be set on the threshold and fire on the click, while still allowing a quick pull to click to fire without entering iron-sights.  Additionally, once the click has been hit, the threshold won't be engaged until the trigger has been released outside of the threshold range, allowing it to be primed for additional clicks.  Relaxed Hip Fire mode is a larger window before engaging the threshold, allowing a slower pull of the trigger to avoid it.  This means the Threshold command will be slightly less responsive when intentionally trying to engage.

Intended to be used with a dual-stage trigger setup, Hip Fire allows a quick pull of the trigger to engage the click without engaging the threshold.  A slower pull or hover will engage the threshold command.  With Exclusive Hip Fire, if the Soft Pull command is engaged, the Full Pull option will no longer function.  So in Exclusive mode, you can activate either the Full or Soft pull, but not both.
55952.ControllerBinding_HapticIntensityTrigger: This sets the intensity of the haptics.
Do not use haptics for this mode.
The haptics will be controlled by the settings in each activator.

The Threshold command will engage fastest here when intentionally enaging it.

This allows for commands such as iron-sights to be set on the threshold and fire on the click, while still allowing a quick pull to click to fire without entering iron-sights.  Additionally, once the click has been hit, the threshold won't be engaged until the trigger has been released outside of the threshold range, allowing it to be primed for additional clicks. A slower pull or hover will engage the threshold command.  This allows for commands such as iron-sights to be set on the threshold and fire on the click, while still allowing a quick pull to click to fire without entering iron-sights.  Additionally, once the click has been hit, the threshold won't be engaged until the trigger has been released outside of the threshold range, allowing it to be primed for additional clicks.  Relaxed Hip Fire mode is a larger window before engaging the threshold, allowing a slower pull of the trigger to avoid it.  This means the Threshold command will be slightly less responsive when intentionally trying to engage.

55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_ScrollWhe: This input will operate as a Scroll Wheel.  Rotating clockwise or counterclockwise will fire off events like a scrollwheel, clickwheel, or jogwheel.
55952.ControllerBinding_SensitivityScrollWheel: Controls the sensitivity of the scrollwheel.  This determines how much of a rotation is required for the next command to fire.
55952.ControllerBinding_HapticIntensityScrollW: This sets the intensity of the haptics.
Do not use haptics for this mode.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelClockwise_D: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when rotating clockwise.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelCounterCloc: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when rotating counter clockwise.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelClick_Descr: This command will be performed when you click the pad/stick.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelTouch_Descr: This command will be performed when you touch the pad/stick.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList0_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the first item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList1_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the second item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList2_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the third item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList3_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the fourth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList4_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the fifth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList5_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the sixth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList6_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the seventh item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList7_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the eighth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList8_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the ninth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelList9_Descr: You can assign a button or key to be sent to the game when the tenth item is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelListWrap_De: When selected, scrolling past either end of this Scroll Wheel's command list will cause it to wrap to the other end of the list. Otherwise, scrolling past an end won't generate any command.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelListWrap_On: When scrolling in a single direction, the list will restart once either end is reached.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelListWrap_Of: When scrolling through commands, once the last item in a particular direction is hit, no further output will be sent until the other direction is sent.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelType_Descri: Sets the type of motion required to move through the command list.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelType_Circle: The scroll wheel will swipe in a circular direction
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelType_Scroll: Make circular motions to move forward or backward in the Scroll Wheel's command list.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelType_Horizo: The scroll wheel will swipe in a horizontal direction
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelType_Vertic: The scroll wheel will swipe in a vertical direction
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelInvert_Desc: Inverts the direction that you need to swipe to move 'forward' in the set of commands for this Scroll Wheel.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelInvert_Off_: The scroll wheel direction will not be inverted.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelInvert_On_D: The scroll wheel direction will be inverted.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_De: This determines how long the scroll wheel will continue to scroll when flicked. Low friction results in a longer spin.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_Of: If off the scroll wheel will have no momentum.  It will act as if scroll wheel mode is disabled.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_Lo: With Low Friction, the scroll wheel will continue to rotate for a long period after being flicked, slowly coming to a stop.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_Me: With Medium Friction, the scroll wheel will rotate for a period after being flicked, gradually coming to a stop.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_Hi: With High Friction, the scroll wheel will spin for a short duration, quickly come to a stop after being flicked.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScrollWheelFriction_No: With No Friction, the scroll wheel will spin forever after being flicked without outside intervention.
55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_TouchMenu: This input will act as a Touch Menu.  Touch Menus display on-screen when your finger touches the Touch Pad.  Clicking on one of the shown buttons will fire off the appropriate command.  Touchmenus can have a variety of buttons, layouts, size, opacity, and can use icons.

55952.ControllerBinding_HotbarDismissAfterActi: Depending on this setting the menu can either dismiss itself after activating on an item or remain active allowing the player to activate the selected item multiple times
When this setting is enabled the menu will dismiss itself after a command fires
When this setting is disabled the menu will remain visible after a command fires
55952.ControllerBinding_HotbarRecenterEachTime: Depending on this option the menu is invoked it can either remember the previously selected item or reset the selection to the centermost item
When this setting is enabled each time the menu is invoked the selected item will be reset to the middle-most command
When this setting is disabled the menu will remember the selected command from the previous time it was invoked
55952.ControllerBinding_HotbarScrollWrap_Descr: When the menu scrolls to the end of the command list it can either wrap around to the other side or stop scrolling.
55952.ControllerBinding_HotbarScrollWrap_On_De: When this setting is enabled each time the menu will wrap around to the other side when you scroll over the end of the command list
55952.ControllerBinding_HotbarScrollWrap_Off_D: When this setting is disabled the menu will stop scrolling when it reaches the end of the command list
55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_MouseRegi: This input will act as a Mouse Region.  Mouse Region sends mouse input to a game, but treats the pad as a 1:1 map to screen space, so touching a particular place on the pad will always put the cursor in the same place on the screen.  In addition to working great for top-down style games, regions can be restricted to certain areas of the screen, scaled, stretched and mode-shifted in to select mini-maps, toolbars, inventory, etc.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseRegionClick_Descr: This command will be performed when you click the pad/stick.
55952.ControllerBinding_ScaleMouseRegion_Descr: This will scale the size of the region that is mapped to the outer extents of the pad/stick.
55952.ControllerBinding_PositionXMouse_Descrip: This is the on screen horizontal position that the region will be centered around.
55952.ControllerBinding_PositionYMouse_Descrip: This is the on screen vertical position that the region will be centered around.
55952.ControllerBinding_TeleportStart_Descript: When activated, should the mouse cursor be snapped to the center of the region?
55952.ControllerBinding_TeleportStart_On_Descr: Snap mouse cursor to the center of the region on mode activation
55952.ControllerBinding_TeleportStop_Descripti: When you stop touching or disable the mode shift, should the mouse be snapped back to the position it was before the mode shift was engaged?
55952.ControllerBinding_TeleportStop_On_Descri: This will snap back the mouse to the previous position on the release of the trackpad or end of the mode shift.
55952.ControllerBinding_TeleportStop_Off_Descr: This will leave the mouse postition as-is on the release of the trackpad or end of the mode shift.
55952.ControllerBinding_HorizontalSensitivityM: Scale the horizontal region.  You can use this to change the on-screen region from a circle to an ellipse or a line.
55952.ControllerBinding_RotationMouseRegion_De: Rotates the output to the joystick, such that pushing the physical stick "North" results in an output of "East", when set to 90°
55952.ControllerBinding_VerticalSensitivityMou: Scale the vertical region.  You can use this to change the on-screen region from a circle to an ellipse or a line.
55952.ControllerBinding_InvertMouseRegionX_Des: Flip inputs to the region horizontally.
55952.ControllerBinding_InvertMouseRegionY_Des: Flip inputs to the region vertically.
55952.ControllerBinding_MouseRegionTouch_Descr: A command sent while touching the pad.  Commands are 'held down' until you stop touching, which is useful for moving your player.
55952.ControllerBinding_ModeDropDown_RadialMen: This input will act as a Radial Menu.  Radial Menus display on-screen when your finger touches the Touch Pad.  Clicking on one of the shown buttons will fire off the appropriate command.  RadialMenus can have a variety of buttons, layouts, size, opacity, and can use icons.
55952.ControllerBinding_RadialMenuPosX_Descrip: This determines where the Radial Menu will appear on screen.  Adjust this slider to adjust the horizontal position.
55952.ControllerBinding_RadialMenuPosY_Descrip: This determines where the Radial Menu will appear on screen.  Adjust this slider to adjust the vertical position.
55952.ControllerBinding_RadialMenuButtonType_D: The interaction with the radial menu can work in a few different ways.  Click commands require the pad or stick to be clicked to use.  If set to touch release/modeshift end, the command will be sent when it stops receiving input or if it's on a modeshift, when that modeshift ends.  "Always" will always send the button so long as the option is highlighted.

55952.ControllerBinding_RadialMenuButtonType_T: This activates the menu item when the trackpad is no longer touched or when the mode shift button is released. For joysticks any position outside of the deadzone is considered touched.

55952.ControllerBinding_RadialMenuShowLabels_O: Display Command Label on Button Enabled

Display Command Label on Button Disabled

55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Desc: Activators determine how the input responds to you.  Is it a regular press, a long press, a double tap?  Select them here or remove them.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_None: Selecting this option will remove the activator and any commands it contains.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Full: Regular Press Activator are the default type.  When you press the button, it activates and stays on until you release it.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Doub: Double Press Activator requires a quick double tap of the input to activate.  If held on the second press, it will remain pressed.  Any interruptable activators on the same button will not fire if a double press is fired, and will be paused until the double press time has passed.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Long: Long Press Activator requires the button to be held for a period of time to activate.  Once the long press time has passed, it will activate stay on until you release it.  Any interruptable activators on the same button will not fire if a long press is fired, and will be paused until the button is released while under the long press time.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Star: Start Press Activator activates when the button is pressed.  It is immediately deactivates even if the button continues to be held.  This is useful, particularly when used with a Release Press Activator, to convert a Toggle into a Hold, such as a Toggle Crouch command.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Rele: Release Press Activator activates and deactivates when the button is released.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Soft: Soft Press Activator activates when the button or trigger is pressed partway.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Anal: Analog Activator produces an analog output.
55952.ControllerBinding_ActivatorDropDown_Chor: Button Chord Activator activates when the both the button owning the activator and the chorded button are pressed.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_Binding_Desc: You can assign one or more commands to this activator.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_ActivateStic: Virtual controllers can create a virtual thumbstick or trackpad under a button while it is pressed. This is good for machineguns that can be aimed with the same finger that's holding down the trigger.
This activator behaves normally and doesn't activate a virtual analog stick or trackpad.
While this button is held the same finger will also control the virtual left analog stick.
While this button is held the same finger will also control the virtual right analog stick.
While this button is held the same finger will also control the center virtual trackpad.
While this button is held the same finger will also control the left virtual trackpad.
While this button is held the same finger will also control the right virtual trackpad.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_Toggle_Descr: Toggle will make this activator continue to be active after releasing it until it is pressed again.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_Toggle_On_De: This activator continues to be active after releasing it until it is pressed again.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_Toggle_Off_D: This activator will act as a tradition button where it is held on until the button is released.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_Interruptabl: Interruptable activators can be paused or stopped by other activators.  For example, a Long Press activator can interrupt a Full Press activator so the Full Press only fires if the Long Press doesn't.  If not interruptable, it ignores the other activator in regards to behavior.

This activator will pause or not fire at all if other activators are in play.  Long Press, Double Press, etc. will cause it to wait for their conditions to be met before this activator is allowed to activate itself.  If those other activators fire, this one will not.
This activator will ignore other activators and always activate/deactivate as if it were alone.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_StartDelay_D: The activator will wait for this period of time after the button has been pressed before activating.  This delay will offset the entire period the button is held, so if no end delay is set, the total period of time the button is held will be the same, just delayed.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_EndDelay_Des: The activator will wait for this period of time after the button has been released before deactivating.  The end delay will make a button be active for longer than it was physically held.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_HapticIntens: This defines the strength of haptics on activation and deactivation of the activator.
Low haptics on activation and deactivation of the activator.
Medium haptics on activation and deactivation of the activator.
High haptics on activation and deactivation of the activator.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_CycleBinding: Cycle Commands will make this activator cycle through each of its commands each time it is activated, in the order listed in the Layout.
When on this will make this activator cycle through each of its commands in order each time it is activated.
When off all commands will be fired at the same time.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_HoldRepeats_: Turbo will make this activator activate and deactivate at a rapid pace while held.  Can be used in combination with cycle commands.
Turbo will make this activator activate and deactivate at a rapid pace while held.  Can be used in combination with cycle commands.
When Off, holding will just hold the button, not repeat it.
55952.ControllerBinding_FullPress_RepeatRate_D: The speed of Turbo will be set by this slider.

55952.ControllerBinding_SoftPress_Interruptabl: Interruptable activators can be paused or stopped by other activators.  For example, a Long Press activator can interrupt a Full Press activator so the Full Press only fires if the Long Press doesn't.  If not interruptable, it ignores the other activator in regards to behavior.

This activator will pause or not fire at all if other activators are in play.  Long Press, Double Press, etc. will cause it to wait for their conditions to be met before this activator is allowed to activate itself.  If those other activators fire, this one will not.
This activator will ignore other activators and always activate/deactivate as if it were alone.
55952.ControllerBinding_SoftPress_StartDelay_D: The activator will wait for this period of time after the button has been pressed before activating.  This delay will offset the entire period the button is held, so if no end delay is set, the total period of time the button is held will be the same, just delayed.
55952.ControllerBinding_SoftPress_EndDelay_Des: The activator will wait for this period of time after the button has been released before deactivating.  The end delay will make a button be active for longer than it was physically held.

55952.SteamUI_ValveSurvey_PromptLabel:
Please take a moment to complete the following short survey. Each month, Steam collects data about what kinds of computer hardware and software our customers are using. The survey data is incredibly helpful to us in that it ensures that we're making good decisions about what kinds of technology investments to make and products to offer.

The data we collect is anonymous and won't be associated with your account.

55952.SteamUI_ValveSurvey_ResultsLabel:

If you'd like to see how your computer compares to those of other Steam subscribers, you can view the compiled results of the survey by selecting 'View Survey Results' below.

89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat0: Do not suggest a specific category, and instead let your fans pick the category they think best fits your game. The event will still include a link to the nominations page.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat50_desc: Maybe it was its immersive gameplay, or its gripping story... its well-crafted characters, immaculate design, or addictive multiplayer. Whatever the reason, the winner of 2020's Game of the Year Award is an instant classic.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat51_desc: The VR Game of the Year isn't merely masquerading as regular reality. This game improves on reality, taking advantage of the medium of VR and pushing the boundaries of the virtual realm.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat52_desc: This game has been out for a while. The team is well past the debut of their creative baby, but being the good parents they are, these devs continue to nurture and support their creation. This game, to this day, is still getting new content after all these years.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat53_desc: There are some games out there that just aren't the same when you play by yourself. Maybe you need to have a friend to watch your back. Maybe you need to have a friend that you can stab in their back. Either way, fun is awaiting those who gather friends together play this game.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat54_desc: Visual style doesn't aspire to real-world graphical fidelity (though a noble goal in itself)… it describes a distinctive look and feel that suffuses an entire game.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat55_desc: The designers of this game are at the front lines of creative experimentation, bringing a fresh perspective and brain-breaking surprises. This game delighted, inspired and entertained with newness never played before.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat56_desc: This is the game that rewards persistence, and is not for the faint of heart. It's the toughest game we've ever loved.
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat57_desc: This unsung hero deserves to be recognized for its outstanding musical score. It's the OST with the MOST!
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat58_desc: Some days, only a narrative-heavy game will hit the spot, and this one packs a wallop. It's as gripping as any soap opera, and as well-tuned as a prestige-TV screenplay. Bravissimo -- for making us feel things!
89358.promo_steamawards2020_cat59_desc: This game is the antidote to a busy day. It's smooth, it's relaxing, it lets your worries melt away. This game is your moment of zen.

89358.Lunar2020_ErrorLoadingVideo: Please use a browser that supports HTML videos to open your envelope.
89358.Lunar2020_StorySubTitle: The Origin of the Chinese Zodiac
89358.Lunar2020_StoryDayOne:
The Jade Emperor summoned all creatures of his kingdom to race to the heavenly palace, declaring the first twelve to arrive would be honored with a place on his new calendar.

Clever Rat was the first to cross the river into the celestial domain. No fan of swimming, Rat hitched a ride atop the trusty Ox—excitedly jumping into the Emperor's garden just before the pair were set to reach shore.

Steady Ox crossed the river with ease. Unconcerned with the results of the race, Ox felt content with a role in Rat's success.
89358.Lunar2020_StoryDayTwo:
Self-sufficient Tiger traveled too carefully to outpace Ox, thinking it better to arrive third than not at all.

Swift Rabbit hopped a log floating nowhere fast. But luck paid off where strategy didn't, and a helpful wind sped the makeshift boat safely on its way.

Flying Dragon's vantage revealed a village in need, so of course Dragon stopped to help—even gifting Rabbit a gust across the river. Honor was far more important than victory, and Dragon found fifth place a fine fit.
89358.Lunar2020_StoryDayThree:
Stealthy Snake had little interest in a long-distance effort, so it wrapped itself unnoticed around Horse's front hoof.

As Horse galloped towards the finish line, Snake uncoiled, startling the steed just long enough to slither into sixth—with the skittish Horse trotting close behind.
89358.Lunar2020_StoryDayFour:
Goat, Monkey, and Rooster worked together, but let Goat claim eighth as the backbone of their journey. Cheerful Monkey was next, and the strutting Rooster crossed tenth, proud that the order was fair.

Playful Dog was mostly interested in splashing around, feeling eleventh a fine trade for all the fun.

Last came Pig, who'd stopped for a snack n' a snooze—wise enough to know that each animal will have their time in the Emperor's favor.

89358.Settings_GameRecording_Path_NeedRestart: You will need to restart Steam to change your Recordings folder.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_InstantClip: Save the last <1></1> seconds of gameplay as a clip
89358.Settings_GameRecording_TimelineMarker_De: You can annotate your recordings with Timeline Markers. These can be used to reference moments to revisit and/or automatically save footage within a specified time range.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_DiskSpaceTooltip: Steam will match the game's video resolution to choose an appropriate bit rate for each recording. Higher game resolutions require more disk space.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_Length_Modal_Minu: Steam will save the most recent %1$s minutes of video.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_Length_Modal_Infi: Steam will record indefinitely as long as space is available.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_Length_Modal_Neve: Steam will never record this game. Recording hotkeys disabled.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_OptOut_Descriptio: Games added here will not automatically record
89358.Settings_GameRecording_AudioRecording_Mi: Enables recording of your system microphone input along with gameplay audio.
Select if you hear your microphone only in one channel during playback.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_AudioRecording_AG: Automatically adjusts microphone recording level for consistent volume and clarity.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_SystemAudio_Descr: Enables recording sound from all processes running on your computer
89358.Settings_GameRecording_AudioRecording_Ad: Select additional programs to record audio from:
89358.Settings_GameRecording_Cleanup_Confirm: Are you sure you want to delete all existing recordings?
89358.Settings_GameRecording_LowDiskSpace_Head: Low disk space - Unable to record or create clips
89358.Settings_GameRecording_LowDiskSpace_Desc: To free space on your hard drive you can delete files, modify your background recording settings, or change the location of your recording folder to another drive.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_NotEnoughDiskSpac: Not enough hard drive space for your selection (%1$s available)
89358.Settings_VideoRecording_NvidiaDriverUpda: Your NVIDIA driver is out of date. To use your graphics card to speed up video encoding, update to the latest driver version (%1$s or newer) from the NVIDIA website, then restart Steam.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_BitRate_Modal_Aut: Steam uses the game's video resolution to choose an appropriate bit rate for each recording. Selecting a higher quality level will result in a better looking recording but consume more disk space.
89358.Settings_GameRecording_VideoMaxHeight_De: Width will be automatically set to preserve the game's aspect ratio
89358.ClipManager_Explainer_Header: Here's where you'll find the screenshots, clips, and game recordings you've taken in game.
89358.ClipManager_Explainer_ScreenshotTip: Take a screenshot by pressing %1$s while in game.
89358.ClipManager_Explainer_Recording: An easy way to record, rewind, review, clip, save & share your gameplay.
89358.ClipManager_Explainer_AllContentFiltered: No media matches the current filters. Please change the filter options above to see results

89358.RecordingState_BackgroundRec_LowDiskSpac: Disk space too low to record
